*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Henry Austin, October 14, 1830. Discouraged by confusion in State government. Thinks territorial government for Texas might improve conditions. */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Extracts. Letter from S. F. Austin to Henry Austin. [Copy.]*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="10-14-1830">Oct'r 14th 1830*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I find on examination of my letters which came in my absence that things are quite at sixes and sevens both at *location_mentioned*Saltillo */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Bexar*/location_mentioned*— party spirit runs high and the former place is rather a hot bed particularly for a *person_mentioned*member of the Legislature*/person_mentioned*. The *person_mentioned*Govr Viesca*/person_mentioned* has offered his resignation ... I hear that *person_mentioned*Teran */person_mentioned*is expected on to *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*or *location_mentioned*La Bahia*/location_mentioned* soon—*/p*
*p*Under the present prospect I think it quite doubtfull whether anything can be done with the *location_mentioned*canal business*/location_mentioned*— I fear that nothing can be obtained from the *person_mentioned*Legislature */person_mentioned*that will tend to promote the prosperity of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*— Should we become a *location_mentioned*Territory */location_mentioned*perhaps some- thing may be done towards raising funds for the *location_mentioned*Canal*/location_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*One of the *person_mentioned*Texas member*/person_mentioned*s has been suspended, the other not but so far as I can judge there is a very great excitement, and nothing like union or harmony amongst the *person_mentioned*officers of Govt*/person_mentioned*., and the *person_mentioned*people at *location_mentioned*Saltillo*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* ...*/p*
*p*I shall never be content until I am clear of all kind of public business and can concentrate all my affairs to my *location_mentioned*farm house*/location_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*Farewell, I hope you may have a calm run to the *location_mentioned*U. S.*/location_mentioned*—it is more than I expect to have for the next two years, and God knows whether I shall ever see much quiet— our Govt affairs are so continually in an uproar, and so very changeable that it will give me trouble placed as I am, tho' I think it will not materially retard the advancement of this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. A.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
